Posts.Title: Just diagnosed - tired of crying, ready to get on with it! lighthouselady bcisnofun

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2013 08:19PM denise4603 wrote: Back in the hospital. After nearly 8 weeks my right incision is red and PS admitted me for iv antibiotics tonight and surgery tomorrow. May lose my tissue expander depending on how bad it is when he opens me up again. Best case scenario is open it up, wash it out and put in a new drain. Feels like I will never get to go back to work or start my chemo. This started when my right drain fell out all by itself over 2 weeks ago. My left drain has been in almost 8 weeks and still putting out 30-40ccs. The right side was getting fluid removed with a needle every week, but today it was red and PS's face fell when he saw it. Sounds like Monica and Vivian are having their trials as well. Sorry to hear this and hope all clear up quickly.

Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2013 04:19PM denise4603 wrote: Thanks to all who wished me well on Friday the 13th. My surgery (BMX with TE) took about 5 hours and seemed like 5 minutes because of course I was asleep. They gave me Percoset which made me vomit, and then switched to oxycodone. Hospital stay was not fun - don't know how some of these incompetents keep their jobs. I came home Saturday evening and my husband has been waiting on me hand and foot! If I don't move at all I have no pain, but any arm or hand movement such as lifting my coffee cup, hurts A LOT.  The drains are fairly simple to take care of. Mostly I am just taking medicine, sleeping, and reading. I guess that is ok considering I was still in surgery 48 hours ago.  My best wishes to all those ladies who have surgeries still ahead, I am incredibly happy to have this part behind me and so will you! Denise4603
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2013 07:58PM denise4603 wrote: Today is Day 9 since my BMX with TE.  A slight headache, a sore chest, and still walking like an ape because my drains hurt too much to put my arms down. But they are not producing too much so I am hoping that they will be gone by my daughters wedding in 20 days.  It would be so wonderful to have a real shower. Tomorrow morning I have an appt with my breast surgeon to get my path report. Also, after a week of waiting on me, my hubby is going back to work.  It's a little scary, but I think I will be ok. Great to read about all the rest of you who completed your surgeries this week and put it in the past.

Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2013 03:35PM denise4603 wrote: Hi BC friends, Home from another 3 day stay in the hospital and another surgery. Went for my weekly fill and PS thought I looked "red". My right drain had fallen out on its own about 2 weeks earlier and fluid was trapped inside. He admitted me to hospital for IV antibiotics and surgery. Re-opened my right incision, drained fluid, washed it out, put in a new drain and stitched it back up. He says we are not out of the woods yet. We will have to see what my body does now. Might lose the expander after all, but hoping we caught it in time. More oral antibiotics at home. Back to PS tomorrow. Vivian - Sounds like we are having similar issues. I pray for you as I do for all the ladies. May everything turn out all right. Monica - so glad the fevers are gone. You have been through so much, it's time for the rest to go by easily. Hurray for Cheryl...you can skip the chemo!
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Recently I have noticed more expander pain.  It seems the area is waking up now and I feel more.  It is not constant though, just occasional.  Should I put anything on my chest, like heat or cold?

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2013 09:32PM denise4603 wrote: Hi Girls, Yes, so as I expected my drains had to stay in today So one more week without a shower Got another fill 75cc each side Tomorrow have a camisole appointment to get an undergarment for my daughter's wedding next Saturday.  They usually won't see you until the drains are gone, but I guess they are making an exception for me because of the wedding! Hope everyone is healing today and making progress. Denise
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2013 08:09PM denise4603 wrote: School counselor - Yes, this is really painful. There seem to be a few lucky ones who feel more "numb", but I, like you have had a lot more pain than I anticipated.  My BMX was 9/13 and I still have all 4 drains. Percoset made me vomit, so I just sit still a lot to lessen the drain pain. Pillows pressed on my chest seems to help expander pain.  Good Luck to you. Better days ahead for all of us. 90 minute wait in the examining room of my surgeon today. But good news...pathology says no change in my stage or grade. Proceeding with "the plan"  of 12 weeks of taxol, one year herceptin. Sandra - I haven't had anyone tell me to massage anything yet. Right now I think it would hurt more than help. I will ask my PS about heat/cold at next appt.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2013 10:09PM denise4603 wrote: Thanks to all who offered advice regarding hiding my drain bulbs in the dress for my daughters wedding. The night before the wedding my prosthetic bra came in and the nice lady worked with me until 7:30PM getting it to look natural. I ended up placing the bulbs in cotton pouches attached to my new bra with velcro on my sides. They did not show and the day was perfect. HOWEVER.....when my husband undressed me at night and removed those fake breasts, I could see that my right incision, and my right drain opening were red, hot, painful and swollen. My doctor prescribed Bactrim. I hope it works. I don't want to lose an expander and have to start all over just from trying to look normal for one day!
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: denise4603 wrote: My doctor is off sailing on his yacht this week, so I am turning to you board members for help. Two weeks ago I had a SNB. Two days ago I began to get swelling under my arm around the surgery site. The swelling goes down with icepacks and gets worse in the evenings after a full day of mild activity.  Is this lymphedema or normal post-surgical swelling?
